com.powerup.logic

Class Game

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.powerup.logic.Game

  • public final class Game
extends Object
    Sets up and provides access to the game's logic components.
    Since:
    2014-01-22
    Author:
    Oliver Lewisohn

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Game()
      Sets up the board and market.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Game

        public Game()
        Sets up the board and market.

    • Method Detail

      • createPlayers

        public void createPlayers(int n,
                 String[] playerNames)
        Creates new players for the game.

        Note: the only reason this method is public is so it can be used in JUnit testing. It is not called from anywhere outside of the Game class.

        Parameters:
        n - The number of players.
        playerNames - The names of the players.

      • determineStartOrder

        public void determineStartOrder()
        Determines the starting order of the players.

        Note: the only reason this method is public is so it can be used in JUnit testing. It is not called from anywhere outside of the Game class.

      • end

        public void end()
        Ends the game.

        Re-sorts the list of players by their total cash and shows the results dialog, where they are revealed in order from least cash to most.

      • getBoard

        public Board getBoard()

      • getDoe

        public DoE getDoe()

      • getMarket

        public Market getMarket()

      • getPlayer

        public Player getPlayer(int i)
        Returns a player based on the given ID.

        The IDs run from 0 to 3, with 0 being the player who had the first turn.

        Parameters:
        i - The ID of the player to be fetched
        Returns:
        The player in question.

      • getPlayers

        public Player[] getPlayers()

      • getTurn

        public Turn getTurn()

      • getWindow

        public Window getWindow()

      • launch

        public void launch(int numberOfPlayers,
          String[] playerNames,
          boolean energyDept)
        Invokes the primary game frame.
        Parameters:
        numberOfPlayers - The number of players in the game.
        playerNames - A list of the names for the players.
        energyDept - True if the DoE was selected, false otherwise.

      • newTurn

        public void newTurn(int n)
        Starts a new turn of the game.
        Parameters:
        n - The ID of the player whose turn it is.

      • setUp

        public void setUp(Window window)
        Runs some setup methods and begins the first turn.

        This cannot be combined with the launch method because the GameFrame is invoked later by SwingUtilities, and we must wait for it to load.

        Parameters:
        window - The primary game window.

      • start

        public void start()
        Launches the graphical user interface with the "start" frame.

      • start

        public void start(Player[] players)
        Launches the graphical user interface with the "start" frame.

        Also fills in the four player names to match the parameter list.

        Parameters:
        players - The list of players, for example from the previous game.
